description: Pharmacy First pathway for assessing suspected infected insect bites and cellulitis risk.
inclusion: Patients with localized skin infection following an insect bite.
Symptoms present for 14 days or fewer without systemic sepsis features.
Able to take flucloxacillin or macrolide alternatives if required.
exclusion: Anaphylaxis, airway compromise, or systemic allergic reaction.
Rapidly spreading cellulitis with systemic upset or sepsis.
Bites involving the face with orbital involvement or near prosthetic joints.
safetyNetting: Seek urgent care if redness spreads rapidly, fever develops, or streaking appears.
Return if swelling or pain worsens after 48 hours of treatment.
Advise elevation of affected limb and avoidance of further scratching.

questions.label: Signs of anaphylaxis or airway compromise

warnings: Clarify penicillin allergy status before supplying antibiotics.

result.headline: Emergency referral - suspected anaphylaxis
result.summary: Call 999 and administer adrenaline if trained to do so.
actions: Lie patient flat and raise legs if tolerated.

pass.label: Severe infection indicators present - urgent referral required.

result.headline: Urgent referral - suspected cellulitis
result.summary: Rapid spread or systemic symptoms require urgent medical review.

result.headline: Refer - immunocompromise is an exclusion
result.summary: Requires GP follow-up due to higher complication risk.

outcomes.description: Oral antibiotic indicated with penicillin allergy

result.headline: Supply Clarithromycin for 5 days
result.summary: Moderate infection requires oral therapy and penicillin allergy recorded.
actions: Supply Clarithromycin 500 mg twice daily for 5 days (adjust paediatric dose).
Advise limb elevation, antihistamine for itch, and wound hygiene.
Provide written safety-netting including escalation triggers.

supply.dosage: Take 500 mg twice daily for 5 days (paediatric dose weight adjusted)
supply.notes: Check for drug interactions and hepatic impairment.

result.headline: Supply Flucloxacillin for 5 days
result.summary: Moderate infection suitable for Pharmacy First oral antibiotic supply.
actions: Supply Flucloxacillin 500 mg four times daily for 5 days (paediatric dose weight adjusted).
Advise elevation, antihistamines for itch, and avoidance of scratching.

supply.product: Flucloxacillin 500 mg capsules or oral solution
supply.dosage: Take 500 mg four times daily for 5 days (paediatric dose weight adjusted)
supply.notes: Take on an empty stomach; review adherence after 48 hours.

result.headline: Self-care advice for mild insect bite
result.summary: Provide symptomatic management with watchful waiting.
actions: Recommend oral antihistamine and topical hydrocortisone 1% for itch (if suitable).
Advise cold compresses and elevation of affected limb.
Arrange follow-up if redness spreads or symptoms persist beyond 3 days.
safetyNet: Seek urgent care if systemic symptoms develop or redness spreads rapidly.
Return for reassessment if no improvement in 48 hours.
